messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Flylady and alternatives
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/30/02 7:55:28 AM Eastern Daylight Time, ... i have been successful and never used the planner, in fact i made it become my homeschooling
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/30/02 7:55:28 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
mvhunt1@... writes:


> That's the URL for System Goddess. I had to look it up too, I tried
> Fly Lady and ended up with a very nicely laid out planner which I
> never look at!
>
> Michelle H
>
>

i have been successful and never used the planner, in fact i made it become
my homeschooling notebook, where i journal, document, and keep
ideas.......but I got into the HABIT by doing a few simple things
consistently. Manageable pieces, or babysteps as they call it at flylady. If
it gets too complicated, i drop it. I deleted most of the reminder messages,
then unsubscribed altogether. It can be as structured or unstructured as you
like, like unhousekeeping LOL
Ang
SAHM to
Megan Elizabeth 8/8/92 8lbs 8oz
Ashlyn Olivia 7/25/99 9lbs 8oz
Christian James 6/09/01 9lbs 5oz

messages.subject: Re: Flylady and alternatives
messages.msgSnippet: http://www.mymessyhouse.com/ That s the URL for System Goddess.  I had to look it up too, I tried Fly Lady and ended up with a very nicely laid out planner
messages.messageBody:
http://www.mymessyhouse.com/

That's the URL for System Goddess. I had to look it up too, I tried
Fly Lady and ended up with a very nicely laid out planner which I
never look at!

Michelle H

messages.subject: Flylady and alternatives
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/29/2002 12:33:38 PM Pacific Daylight Time, ... Have a look at the System Goddess --- it is simpler and humorous -- might be a better fit!!
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/29/2002 12:33:38 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> It's funny you mentioned flylady, because I tried it,
> but I'm wayyy to disorganized to even establish her
> routines. Heck, I can't even get myself to put shoes
> on most mornings :)

Have a look at the System Goddess --- it is simpler and humorous -- might be
a better fit!! Sorry I don't have the url - but you can find it with a google
search, I'm sure.

--pam
